30/*
31 * This file implements HW context support. On gen5+ a HW context consists of an
32 * opaque GPU object which is referenced at times of context saves and restores.
33 * With RC6 enabled, the context is also referenced as the GPU enters and exists
34 * from RC6 (GPU has it's own internal power context, except on gen5). Though
35 * something like a context does exist for the media ring, the code only
36 * supports contexts for the render ring.
37 *
38 * In software, there is a distinction between contexts created by the user,
39 * and the default HW context. The default HW context is used by GPU clients
40 * that do not request setup of their own hardware context. The default
41 * context's state is never restored to help prevent programming errors. This
42 * would happen if a client ran and piggy-backed off another clients GPU state.
43 * The default context only exists to give the GPU some offset to load as the
44 * current to invoke a save of the context we actually care about. In fact, the
45 * code could likely be constructed, albeit in a more complicated fashion, to
46 * never use the default context, though that limits the driver's ability to
47 * swap out, and/or destroy other contexts.
48 *
49 * All other contexts are created as a request by the GPU client. These contexts
50 * store GPU state, and thus allow GPU clients to not re-emit state (and
51 * potentially query certain state) at any time. The kernel driver makes
52 * certain that the appropriate commands are inserted.
53 *
54 * The context life cycle is semi-complicated in that context BOs may live
55 * longer than the context itself because of the way the hardware, and object
56 * tracking works. Below is a very crude representation of the state machine
57 * describing the context life.
58 * refcount pincount active
59 * S0: initial state 0 0 0
60 * S1: context created 1 0 0
61 * S2: context is currently running 2 1 X
62 * S3: GPU referenced, but not current 2 0 1
63 * S4: context is current, but destroyed 1 1 0
64 * S5: like S3, but destroyed 1 0 1
65 *
66 * The most common (but not all) transitions:
67 * S0->S1: client creates a context
68 * S1->S2: client submits execbuf with context
69 * S2->S3: other clients submits execbuf with context
70 * S3->S1: context object was retired
71 * S3->S2: clients submits another execbuf
72 * S2->S4: context destroy called with current context
73 * S3->S5->S0: destroy path
74 * S4->S5->S0: destroy path on current context
75 *
76 * There are two confusing terms used above:
77 * The "current context" means the context which is currently running on the
78 * GPU. The GPU has loaded its state already and has stored away the gtt
79 * offset of the BO. The GPU is not actively referencing the data at this
80 * offset, but it will on the next context switch. The only way to avoid this
81 * is to do a GPU reset.
82 *
83 * An "active context' is one which was previously the "current context" and is
84 * on the active list waiting for the next context switch to occur. Until this
85 * happens, the object must remain at the same gtt offset. It is therefore
86 * possible to destroy a context, but it is still active.
87 *
88 */
89
90#include <sys/cdefs.h>
91__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: i915_gem_context.c,v 1.9 2018/08/27 14:14:29 riastradh Exp $");
92
93#include <linux/err.h>
94#include <drm/drmP.h>
95#include <drm/i915_drm.h>
96#include "i915_drv.h"
97#include "i915_trace.h"
98
99/* This is a HW constraint. The value below is the largest known requirement
100 * I've seen in a spec to date, and that was a workaround for a non-shipping
101 * part. It should be safe to decrease this, but it's more future proof as is.
102 */
103#define GEN6_CONTEXT_ALIGN (64<<10)
104#define GEN7_CONTEXT_ALIGN 4096
105
106static size_t get_context_alignment(struct drm_device *dev)
107{
108 if (IS_GEN6(dev))
109 return GEN6_CONTEXT_ALIGN;
110
111 return GEN7_CONTEXT_ALIGN;
112}
113
114static int get_context_size(struct drm_device *dev)
115{
116 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
117 int ret;
118 u32 reg;
119
120 switch (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen) {
121 case 6:
122 reg = I915_READ(CXT_SIZE);
123 ret = GEN6_CXT_TOTAL_SIZE(reg) * 64;
124 break;
125 case 7:
126 reg = I915_READ(GEN7_CXT_SIZE);
127 if (IS_HASWELL(dev))
128 ret = HSW_CXT_TOTAL_SIZE;
129 else
130 ret = GEN7_CXT_TOTAL_SIZE(reg) * 64;
131 break;
132 case 8:
133 ret = GEN8_CXT_TOTAL_SIZE;
134 break;
135 default:
136 BUG();
137 }
138
139 return ret;
140}
141
142static void i915_gem_context_clean(struct intel_context *ctx)
143{
144 struct i915_hw_ppgtt *ppgtt = ctx->ppgtt;
145 struct i915_vma *vma, *next;
146
147 if (!ppgtt)
148 return;
149
150 list_for_each_entry_safe(vma, next, &ppgtt->base.inactive_list,
151 mm_list) {
152 if (WARN_ON(__i915_vma_unbind_no_wait(vma)))
153 break;
154 }
155}
156
157void i915_gem_context_free(struct kref *ctx_ref)
158{
159 struct intel_context *ctx = container_of(ctx_ref, typeof(*ctx), ref);
160
161 trace_i915_context_free(ctx);
162
163 if (i915.enable_execlists)
164 intel_lr_context_free(ctx);
165
166 /*
167 * This context is going away and we need to remove all VMAs still
168 * around. This is to handle imported shared objects for which
169 * destructor did not run when their handles were closed.
170 */
171 i915_gem_context_clean(ctx);
172
173 i915_ppgtt_put(ctx->ppgtt);
174
175 if (ctx->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state)
176 drm_gem_object_unreference(&ctx->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state->base);
177 list_del(&ctx->link);
178 kfree(ctx);
179}
180
181struct drm_i915_gem_object *
182i915_gem_alloc_context_obj(struct drm_device *dev, size_t size)
183{
184 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj;
185 int ret;
186
187 obj = i915_gem_alloc_object(dev, size);
188 if (obj == NULL)
189 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
190
191 /*
192 * Try to make the context utilize L3 as well as LLC.
193 *
194 * On VLV we don't have L3 controls in the PTEs so we
195 * shouldn't touch the cache level, especially as that
196 * would make the object snooped which might have a
197 * negative performance impact.
198 */
199 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 7 && !IS_VALLEYVIEW(dev)) {
200 ret = i915_gem_object_set_cache_level(obj, I915_CACHE_L3_LLC);
201 /* Failure shouldn't ever happen this early */
202 if (WARN_ON(ret)) {
203 drm_gem_object_unreference(&obj->base);
204 return ERR_PTR(ret);
205 }
206 }
207
208 return obj;
209}
210
211static struct intel_context *
212__create_hw_context(struct drm_device *dev,
213 struct drm_i915_file_private *file_priv)
214{
215 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
216 struct intel_context *ctx;
217 int ret;
218
219 ctx = kzalloc(sizeof(*ctx), GFP_KERNEL);
220 if (ctx == NULL)
221 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
222
223 kref_init(&ctx->ref);
224 list_add_tail(&ctx->link, &dev_priv->context_list);
225 ctx->i915 = dev_priv;
226
227 if (dev_priv->hw_context_size) {
228 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj =
229 i915_gem_alloc_context_obj(dev, dev_priv->hw_context_size);
230 if (IS_ERR(obj)) {
231 ret = PTR_ERR(obj);
232 goto err_out;
233 }
234 ctx->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state = obj;
235 }
236
237 /* Default context will never have a file_priv */
238 if (file_priv != NULL) {
239 ret = idr_alloc(&file_priv->context_idr, ctx,
240 DEFAULT_CONTEXT_HANDLE, 0, GFP_KERNEL);
241 if (ret < 0)
242 goto err_out;
243 } else
244 ret = DEFAULT_CONTEXT_HANDLE;
245
246 ctx->file_priv = file_priv;
247 ctx->user_handle = ret;
248 /* NB: Mark all slices as needing a remap so that when the context first
249 * loads it will restore whatever remap state already exists. If there
250 * is no remap info, it will be a NOP. */
251 ctx->remap_slice = (1 << NUM_L3_SLICES(dev)) - 1;
252
253 ctx->hang_stats.ban_period_seconds = DRM_I915_CTX_BAN_PERIOD;
254
255 return ctx;
256
257err_out:
258 i915_gem_context_unreference(ctx);
259 return ERR_PTR(ret);
260}
261
262/**
263 * The default context needs to exist per ring that uses contexts. It stores the
264 * context state of the GPU for applications that don't utilize HW contexts, as
265 * well as an idle case.
266 */
267static struct intel_context *
268i915_gem_create_context(struct drm_device *dev,
269 struct drm_i915_file_private *file_priv)
270{
271 const bool is_global_default_ctx = file_priv == NULL;
272 struct intel_context *ctx;
273 int ret = 0;
274
275 BUG_ON(!mutex_is_locked(&dev->struct_mutex));
276
277 ctx = __create_hw_context(dev, file_priv);
278 if (IS_ERR(ctx))
279 return ctx;
280
281 if (is_global_default_ctx && ctx->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state) {
282 /* We may need to do things with the shrinker which
283 * require us to immediately switch back to the default
284 * context. This can cause a problem as pinning the
285 * default context also requires GTT space which may not
286 * be available. To avoid this we always pin the default
287 * context.
288 */
289 ret = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_pin(ctx->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state,
290 get_context_alignment(dev), 0);
291 if (ret) {
292 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Couldn't pin %d\n", ret);
293 goto err_destroy;
294 }
295 }
296
297 if (USES_FULL_PPGTT(dev)) {
298 struct i915_hw_ppgtt *ppgtt = i915_ppgtt_create(dev, file_priv);
299
300 if (IS_ERR_OR_NULL(ppgtt)) {
301 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("PPGTT setup failed (%ld)\n",
302 PTR_ERR(ppgtt));
303 ret = PTR_ERR(ppgtt);
304 goto err_unpin;
305 }
306
307 ctx->ppgtt = ppgtt;
308 }
309
310 trace_i915_context_create(ctx);
311
312 return ctx;
313
314err_unpin:
315 if (is_global_default_ctx && ctx->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state)
316 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(ctx->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state);
317err_destroy:
318 idr_remove(&file_priv->context_idr, ctx->user_handle);
319 i915_gem_context_unreference(ctx);
320 return ERR_PTR(ret);
321}
322
323void i915_gem_context_reset(struct drm_device *dev)
324{
325 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
326 int i;
327
328 if (i915.enable_execlists) {
329 struct intel_context *ctx;
330
331 list_for_each_entry(ctx, &dev_priv->context_list, link) {
332 intel_lr_context_reset(dev, ctx);
333 }
334
335 return;
336 }
337
338 for (i = 0; i < I915_NUM_RINGS; i++) {
339 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = &dev_priv->ring[i];
340 struct intel_context *lctx = ring->last_context;
341
342 if (lctx) {
343 if (lctx->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state && i == RCS)
344 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(lctx->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state);
345
346 i915_gem_context_unreference(lctx);
347 ring->last_context = NULL;
348 }
349
350 /* Force the GPU state to be reinitialised on enabling */
351 if (ring->default_context)
352 ring->default_context->legacy_hw_ctx.initialized = false;
353 }
354}
355
356int i915_gem_context_init(struct drm_device *dev)
357{
358 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
359 struct intel_context *ctx;
360 int i;
361
362 /* Init should only be called once per module load. Eventually the
363 * restriction on the context_disabled check can be loosened. */
364 if (WARN_ON(dev_priv->ring[RCS].default_context))
365 return 0;
366
367 if (intel_vgpu_active(dev) && HAS_LOGICAL_RING_CONTEXTS(dev)) {
368 if (!i915.enable_execlists) {
369 DRM_INFO("Only EXECLIST mode is supported in vgpu.\n");
370 return -EINVAL;
371 }
372 }
373
374 if (i915.enable_execlists) {
375 /* NB: intentionally left blank. We will allocate our own
376 * backing objects as we need them, thank you very much */
377 dev_priv->hw_context_size = 0;
378 } else if (HAS_HW_CONTEXTS(dev)) {
379 dev_priv->hw_context_size = round_up(get_context_size(dev), 4096);
380 if (dev_priv->hw_context_size > (1<<20)) {
381 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Disabling HW Contexts; invalid size %d\n",
382 dev_priv->hw_context_size);
383 dev_priv->hw_context_size = 0;
384 }
385 }
386
387 ctx = i915_gem_create_context(dev, NULL);
388 if (IS_ERR(ctx)) {
389 DRM_ERROR("Failed to create default global context (error %ld)\n",
390 PTR_ERR(ctx));
391 return PTR_ERR(ctx);
392 }
393
394 for (i = 0; i < I915_NUM_RINGS; i++) {
395 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = &dev_priv->ring[i];
396
397 /* NB: RCS will hold a ref for all rings */
398 ring->default_context = ctx;
399 }
400
401 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("%s context support initialized\n",
402 i915.enable_execlists ? "LR" :
403 dev_priv->hw_context_size ? "HW" : "fake");
404 return 0;
405}
406
407void i915_gem_context_fini(struct drm_device *dev)
408{
409 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
410 struct intel_context *dctx = dev_priv->ring[RCS].default_context;
411 int i;
412
413 if (dctx->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state) {
414 /* The only known way to stop the gpu from accessing the hw context is
415 * to reset it. Do this as the very last operation to avoid confusing
416 * other code, leading to spurious errors. */
417 intel_gpu_reset(dev);
418
419 /* When default context is created and switched to, base object refcount
420 * will be 2 (+1 from object creation and +1 from do_switch()).
421 * i915_gem_context_fini() will be called after gpu_idle() has switched
422 * to default context. So we need to unreference the base object once
423 * to offset the do_switch part, so that i915_gem_context_unreference()
424 * can then free the base object correctly. */
425 WARN_ON(!dev_priv->ring[RCS].last_context);
426 if (dev_priv->ring[RCS].last_context == dctx) {
427 /* Fake switch to NULL context */
428 WARN_ON(dctx->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state->active);
429 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(dctx->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state);
430 i915_gem_context_unreference(dctx);
431 dev_priv->ring[RCS].last_context = NULL;
432 }
433
434 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(dctx->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state);
435 }
436
437 for (i = 0; i < I915_NUM_RINGS; i++) {
438 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = &dev_priv->ring[i];
439
440 if (ring->last_context)
441 i915_gem_context_unreference(ring->last_context);
442
443 ring->default_context = NULL;
444 ring->last_context = NULL;
445 }
446
447 i915_gem_context_unreference(dctx);
448}
449
450int i915_gem_context_enable(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
451{
452 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
453 int ret;
454
455 if (i915.enable_execlists) {
456 if (ring->init_context == NULL)
457 return 0;
458
459 ret = ring->init_context(req);
460 } else
461 ret = i915_switch_context(req);
462
463 if (ret) {
464 DRM_ERROR("ring init context: %d\n", ret);
465 return ret;
466 }
467
468 return 0;
469}
470
471static int context_idr_cleanup(int id, void *p, void *data)
472{
473 struct intel_context *ctx = p;
474
475 i915_gem_context_unreference(ctx);
476 return 0;
477}
478
479int i915_gem_context_open(struct drm_device *dev, struct drm_file *file)
480{
481 struct drm_i915_file_private *file_priv = file->driver_priv;
482 struct intel_context *ctx;
483
484 idr_init(&file_priv->context_idr);
485
486 idr_preload(GFP_KERNEL);
487 mutex_lock(&dev->struct_mutex);
488 ctx = i915_gem_create_context(dev, file_priv);
489 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
490 idr_preload_end();
491
492 if (IS_ERR(ctx)) {
493 idr_destroy(&file_priv->context_idr);
494 return PTR_ERR(ctx);
495 }
496
497 return 0;
498}
499
500void i915_gem_context_close(struct drm_device *dev, struct drm_file *file)
501{
502 struct drm_i915_file_private *file_priv = file->driver_priv;
503
504 idr_for_each(&file_priv->context_idr, context_idr_cleanup, NULL);
505 idr_destroy(&file_priv->context_idr);
506}
507
508struct intel_context *
509i915_gem_context_get(struct drm_i915_file_private *file_priv, u32 id)
510{
511 struct intel_context *ctx;
512
513 ctx = (struct intel_context *)idr_find(&file_priv->context_idr, id);
514 if (!ctx)
515 return ERR_PTR(-ENOENT);
516
517 return ctx;
518}
519
520static inline int
521mi_set_context(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req, u32 hw_flags)
522{
523 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
524 u32 flags = hw_flags | MI_MM_SPACE_GTT;
525 const int num_rings =
526 /* Use an extended w/a on ivb+ if signalling from other rings */
527 i915_semaphore_is_enabled(ring->dev) ?
528 hweight32(INTEL_INFO(ring->dev)->ring_mask) - 1 :
529 0;
530 int len, i, ret;
531
532 /* w/a: If Flush TLB Invalidation Mode is enabled, driver must do a TLB
533 * invalidation prior to MI_SET_CONTEXT. On GEN6 we don't set the value
534 * explicitly, so we rely on the value at ring init, stored in
535 * itlb_before_ctx_switch.
536 */
537 if (IS_GEN6(ring->dev)) {
538 ret = ring->flush(req, I915_GEM_GPU_DOMAINS, 0);
539 if (ret)
540 return ret;
541 }
542
543 /* These flags are for resource streamer on HSW+ */
544 if (IS_HASWELL(ring->dev) || INTEL_INFO(ring->dev)->gen >= 8)
545 flags |= (HSW_MI_RS_SAVE_STATE_EN | HSW_MI_RS_RESTORE_STATE_EN);
546 else if (INTEL_INFO(ring->dev)->gen < 8)
547 flags |= (MI_SAVE_EXT_STATE_EN | MI_RESTORE_EXT_STATE_EN);
548
549
550 len = 4;
551 if (INTEL_INFO(ring->dev)->gen >= 7)
552 len += 2 + (num_rings ? 4*num_rings + 2 : 0);
553
554 ret = intel_ring_begin(req, len);
555 if (ret)
556 return ret;
557
558 /* WaProgramMiArbOnOffAroundMiSetContext:ivb,vlv,hsw,bdw,chv */
559 if (INTEL_INFO(ring->dev)->gen >= 7) {
560 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_ARB_ON_OFF | MI_ARB_DISABLE);
561 if (num_rings) {
562 struct intel_engine_cs *signaller;
563
564 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_LOAD_REGISTER_IMM(num_rings));
565 for_each_ring(signaller, to_i915(ring->dev), i) {
566 if (signaller == ring)
567 continue;
568
569 intel_ring_emit(ring, RING_PSMI_CTL(signaller->mmio_base));
570 intel_ring_emit(ring, _MASKED_BIT_ENABLE(GEN6_PSMI_SLEEP_MSG_DISABLE));
571 }
572 }
573 }
574
575 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_NOOP);
576 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_SET_CONTEXT);
577 intel_ring_emit(ring, i915_gem_obj_ggtt_offset(req->ctx->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state) |
578 flags);
579 /*
580 * w/a: MI_SET_CONTEXT must always be followed by MI_NOOP
581 * WaMiSetContext_Hang:snb,ivb,vlv
582 */
583 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_NOOP);
584
585 if (INTEL_INFO(ring->dev)->gen >= 7) {
586 if (num_rings) {
587 struct intel_engine_cs *signaller;
588
589 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_LOAD_REGISTER_IMM(num_rings));
590 for_each_ring(signaller, to_i915(ring->dev), i) {
591 if (signaller == ring)
592 continue;
593
594 intel_ring_emit(ring, RING_PSMI_CTL(signaller->mmio_base));
595 intel_ring_emit(ring, _MASKED_BIT_DISABLE(GEN6_PSMI_SLEEP_MSG_DISABLE));
596 }
597 }
598 intel_ring_emit(ring, MI_ARB_ON_OFF | MI_ARB_ENABLE);
599 }
600
601 intel_ring_advance(ring);
602
603 return ret;
604}
605
606static inline bool should_skip_switch(struct intel_engine_cs *ring,
607 struct intel_context *from,
608 struct intel_context *to)
609{
610 if (to->remap_slice)
611 return false;
612
613 if (to->ppgtt && from == to &&
614 !(intel_ring_flag(ring) & to->ppgtt->pd_dirty_rings))
615 return true;
616
617 return false;
618}
619
620static bool
621needs_pd_load_pre(struct intel_engine_cs *ring, struct intel_context *to)
622{
623 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = ring->dev->dev_private;
624
625 if (!to->ppgtt)
626 return false;
627
628 if (INTEL_INFO(ring->dev)->gen < 8)
629 return true;
630
631 if (ring != &dev_priv->ring[RCS])
632 return true;
633
634 return false;
635}
636
637static bool
638needs_pd_load_post(struct intel_engine_cs *ring, struct intel_context *to,
639 u32 hw_flags)
640{
641 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = ring->dev->dev_private;
642
643 if (!to->ppgtt)
644 return false;
645
646 if (!IS_GEN8(ring->dev))
647 return false;
648
649 if (ring != &dev_priv->ring[RCS])
650 return false;
651
652 if (hw_flags & MI_RESTORE_INHIBIT)
653 return true;
654
655 return false;
656}
657
658static int do_switch(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
659{
660 struct intel_context *to = req->ctx;
661 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
662 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = ring->dev->dev_private;
663 struct intel_context *from = ring->last_context;
664 u32 hw_flags = 0;
665 bool uninitialized = false;
666 int ret, i;
667
668 if (from != NULL && ring == &dev_priv->ring[RCS]) {
669 BUG_ON(from->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state == NULL);
670 BUG_ON(!i915_gem_obj_is_pinned(from->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state));
671 }
672
673 if (should_skip_switch(ring, from, to))
674 return 0;
675
676 /* Trying to pin first makes error handling easier. */
677 if (ring == &dev_priv->ring[RCS]) {
678 ret = i915_gem_obj_ggtt_pin(to->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state,
679 get_context_alignment(ring->dev), 0);
680 if (ret)
681 return ret;
682 }
683
684 /*
685 * Pin can switch back to the default context if we end up calling into
686 * evict_everything - as a last ditch gtt defrag effort that also
687 * switches to the default context. Hence we need to reload from here.
688 */
689 from = ring->last_context;
690
691 if (needs_pd_load_pre(ring, to)) {
692 /* Older GENs and non render rings still want the load first,
693 * "PP_DCLV followed by PP_DIR_BASE register through Load
694 * Register Immediate commands in Ring Buffer before submitting
695 * a context."*/
696 trace_switch_mm(ring, to);
697 ret = to->ppgtt->switch_mm(to->ppgtt, req);
698 if (ret)
699 goto unpin_out;
700
701 /* Doing a PD load always reloads the page dirs */
702 to->ppgtt->pd_dirty_rings &= ~intel_ring_flag(ring);
703 }
704
705 if (ring != &dev_priv->ring[RCS]) {
706 if (from)
707 i915_gem_context_unreference(from);
708 goto done;
709 }
710
711 /*
712 * Clear this page out of any CPU caches for coherent swap-in/out. Note
713 * that thanks to write = false in this call and us not setting any gpu
714 * write domains when putting a context object onto the active list
715 * (when switching away from it), this won't block.
716 *
717 * XXX: We need a real interface to do this instead of trickery.
718 */
719 ret = i915_gem_object_set_to_gtt_domain(to->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state, false);
720 if (ret)
721 goto unpin_out;
722
723 if (!to->legacy_hw_ctx.initialized || i915_gem_context_is_default(to)) {
724 hw_flags |= MI_RESTORE_INHIBIT;
725 /* NB: If we inhibit the restore, the context is not allowed to
726 * die because future work may end up depending on valid address
727 * space. This means we must enforce that a page table load
728 * occur when this occurs. */
729 } else if (to->ppgtt &&
730 (intel_ring_flag(ring) & to->ppgtt->pd_dirty_rings)) {
731 hw_flags |= MI_FORCE_RESTORE;
732 to->ppgtt->pd_dirty_rings &= ~intel_ring_flag(ring);
733 }
734
735 /* We should never emit switch_mm more than once */
736 WARN_ON(needs_pd_load_pre(ring, to) &&
737 needs_pd_load_post(ring, to, hw_flags));
738
739 ret = mi_set_context(req, hw_flags);
740 if (ret)
741 goto unpin_out;
742
743 /* GEN8 does *not* require an explicit reload if the PDPs have been
744 * setup, and we do not wish to move them.
745 */
746 if (needs_pd_load_post(ring, to, hw_flags)) {
747 trace_switch_mm(ring, to);
748 ret = to->ppgtt->switch_mm(to->ppgtt, req);
749 /* The hardware context switch is emitted, but we haven't
750 * actually changed the state - so it's probably safe to bail
751 * here. Still, let the user know something dangerous has
752 * happened.
753 */
754 if (ret) {
755 DRM_ERROR("Failed to change address space on context switch\n");
756 goto unpin_out;
757 }
758 }
759
760 for (i = 0; i < MAX_L3_SLICES; i++) {
761 if (!(to->remap_slice & (1<<i)))
762 continue;
763
764 ret = i915_gem_l3_remap(req, i);
765 /* If it failed, try again next round */
766 if (ret)
767 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("L3 remapping failed\n");
768 else
769 to->remap_slice &= ~(1<<i);
770 }
771
772 /* The backing object for the context is done after switching to the
773 * *next* context. Therefore we cannot retire the previous context until
774 * the next context has already started running. In fact, the below code
775 * is a bit suboptimal because the retiring can occur simply after the
776 * MI_SET_CONTEXT instead of when the next seqno has completed.
777 */
778 if (from != NULL) {
779 from->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state->base.read_domains = I915_GEM_DOMAIN_INSTRUCTION;
780 i915_vma_move_to_active(i915_gem_obj_to_ggtt(from->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state), req);
781 /* As long as MI_SET_CONTEXT is serializing, ie. it flushes the
782 * whole damn pipeline, we don't need to explicitly mark the
783 * object dirty. The only exception is that the context must be
784 * correct in case the object gets swapped out. Ideally we'd be
785 * able to defer doing this until we know the object would be
786 * swapped, but there is no way to do that yet.
787 */
788 from->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state->dirty = 1;
789
790 /* obj is kept alive until the next request by its active ref */
791 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(from->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state);
792 i915_gem_context_unreference(from);
793 }
794
795 uninitialized = !to->legacy_hw_ctx.initialized;
796 to->legacy_hw_ctx.initialized = true;
797
798done:
799 i915_gem_context_reference(to);
800 ring->last_context = to;
801
802 if (uninitialized) {
803 if (ring->init_context) {
804 ret = ring->init_context(req);
805 if (ret)
806 DRM_ERROR("ring init context: %d\n", ret);
807 }
808 }
809
810 return 0;
811
812unpin_out:
813 if (ring->id == RCS)
814 i915_gem_object_ggtt_unpin(to->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state);
815 return ret;
816}
817
818/**
819 * i915_switch_context() - perform a GPU context switch.
820 * @req: request for which we'll execute the context switch
821 *
822 * The context life cycle is simple. The context refcount is incremented and
823 * decremented by 1 and create and destroy. If the context is in use by the GPU,
824 * it will have a refcount > 1. This allows us to destroy the context abstract
825 * object while letting the normal object tracking destroy the backing BO.
826 *
827 * This function should not be used in execlists mode. Instead the context is
828 * switched by writing to the ELSP and requests keep a reference to their
829 * context.
830 */
831int i915_switch_context(struct drm_i915_gem_request *req)
832{
833 struct intel_engine_cs *ring = req->ring;
834 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = ring->dev->dev_private;
835
836 WARN_ON(i915.enable_execlists);
837 WARN_ON(!mutex_is_locked(&dev_priv->dev->struct_mutex));
838
839 if (req->ctx->legacy_hw_ctx.rcs_state == NULL) { /* We have the fake context */
840 if (req->ctx != ring->last_context) {
841 i915_gem_context_reference(req->ctx);
842 if (ring->last_context)
843 i915_gem_context_unreference(ring->last_context);
844 ring->last_context = req->ctx;
845 }
846 return 0;
847 }
848
849 return do_switch(req);
850}
851
852static bool contexts_enabled(struct drm_device *dev)
853{
854 return i915.enable_execlists || to_i915(dev)->hw_context_size;
855}
856
857int i915_gem_context_create_ioctl(struct drm_device *dev, void *data,
858 struct drm_file *file)
859{
860 struct drm_i915_gem_context_create *args = data;
861 struct drm_i915_file_private *file_priv = file->driver_priv;
862 struct intel_context *ctx;
863 int ret;
864
865 if (!contexts_enabled(dev))
866 return -ENODEV;
867
868 idr_preload(GFP_KERNEL);
869 ret = i915_mutex_lock_interruptible(dev);
870 if (ret) {
871 idr_preload_end();
872 return ret;
873 }
874
875 ctx = i915_gem_create_context(dev, file_priv);
876 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
877 idr_preload_end();
878 if (IS_ERR(ctx))
879 return PTR_ERR(ctx);
880
881 args->ctx_id = ctx->user_handle;
882 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("HW context %d created\n", args->ctx_id);
883
884 return 0;
885}
886
887int i915_gem_context_destroy_ioctl(struct drm_device *dev, void *data,
888 struct drm_file *file)
889{
890 struct drm_i915_gem_context_destroy *args = data;
891 struct drm_i915_file_private *file_priv = file->driver_priv;
892 struct intel_context *ctx;
893 int ret;
894
895 if (args->ctx_id == DEFAULT_CONTEXT_HANDLE)
896 return -ENOENT;
897
898 ret = i915_mutex_lock_interruptible(dev);
899 if (ret)
900 return ret;
901
902 ctx = i915_gem_context_get(file_priv, args->ctx_id);
903 if (IS_ERR(ctx)) {
904 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
905 return PTR_ERR(ctx);
906 }
907
908 idr_remove(&ctx->file_priv->context_idr, ctx->user_handle);
909 i915_gem_context_unreference(ctx);
910 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
911
912 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("HW context %d destroyed\n", args->ctx_id);
913 return 0;
914}
915
916int i915_gem_context_getparam_ioctl(struct drm_device *dev, void *data,
917 struct drm_file *file)
918{
919 struct drm_i915_file_private *file_priv = file->driver_priv;
920 struct drm_i915_gem_context_param *args = data;
921 struct intel_context *ctx;
922 int ret;
923
924 ret = i915_mutex_lock_interruptible(dev);
925 if (ret)
926 return ret;
927
928 ctx = i915_gem_context_get(file_priv, args->ctx_id);
929 if (IS_ERR(ctx)) {
930 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
931 return PTR_ERR(ctx);
932 }
933
934 args->size = 0;
935 switch (args->param) {
936 case I915_CONTEXT_PARAM_BAN_PERIOD:
937 args->value = ctx->hang_stats.ban_period_seconds;
938 break;
939 case I915_CONTEXT_PARAM_NO_ZEROMAP:
940 args->value = ctx->flags & CONTEXT_NO_ZEROMAP;
941 break;
942 default:
943 ret = -EINVAL;
944 break;
945 }
946 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
947
948 return ret;
949}
950
951int i915_gem_context_setparam_ioctl(struct drm_device *dev, void *data,
952 struct drm_file *file)
953{
954 struct drm_i915_file_private *file_priv = file->driver_priv;
955 struct drm_i915_gem_context_param *args = data;
956 struct intel_context *ctx;
957 int ret;
958
959 ret = i915_mutex_lock_interruptible(dev);
960 if (ret)
961 return ret;
962
963 ctx = i915_gem_context_get(file_priv, args->ctx_id);
964 if (IS_ERR(ctx)) {
965 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
966 return PTR_ERR(ctx);
967 }
968
969 switch (args->param) {
970 case I915_CONTEXT_PARAM_BAN_PERIOD:
971 if (args->size)
972 ret = -EINVAL;
973#ifdef __NetBSD__
974 else if (args->value < ctx->hang_stats.ban_period_seconds &&
975 !DRM_SUSER())
976 ret = -EPERM;
977#else
978 else if (args->value < ctx->hang_stats.ban_period_seconds &&
979 !capable(CAP_SYS_ADMIN))
980 ret = -EPERM;
981#endif
982 else
983 ctx->hang_stats.ban_period_seconds = args->value;
984 break;
985 case I915_CONTEXT_PARAM_NO_ZEROMAP:
986 if (args->size) {
987 ret = -EINVAL;
988 } else {
989 ctx->flags &= ~CONTEXT_NO_ZEROMAP;
990 ctx->flags |= args->value ? CONTEXT_NO_ZEROMAP : 0;
991 }
992 break;
993 default:
994 ret = -EINVAL;
995 break;
996 }
997 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
998
999 return ret;
1000}
